title: Understanding the Elementor Interface
description: Get familiar with Elementor's interface and basic controls to start building beautiful pages.

blocks.content: Before diving into creating stunning pages with Elementor, it's essential to understand its interface and basic controls. This guide will walk you through everything you need to know to get started.

The Elementor interface consists of three main areas:

  • Preview Area: The main canvas where you see your page design in real-time
  • Panel: The left sidebar containing widgets and settings
  • Menu: The hamburger menu at the top-left for global actions

The panel is your primary toolbox in Elementor. It contains:

  • Elements/Widgets tab for adding content
  • Global settings for colors and typography
  • Page settings for layout and background
  • Responsive mode controls
  • History and revisions
